title: Mathematics Education Design and Practice Using Augmented Reality

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental math concepts (functions, geometry, statistics) and experience with digital devices
context.additional_context: A project-based learning environment considering learner roles (students/job seekers). Emphasizes competencies in developing and evaluating augmented reality math tools applicable in secondary school settings.

learning_goals: Learners can create simulation content explaining 3D geometric concepts using augmented reality tools.

Graduate students analyze learner interaction data (e.g., eye-tracking, manipulation frequency, time spent) collected during AR-based math problem-solving processes, applying methods that achieve ≥80% suitability in ≥2 of 3 rubric items for instructional effectiveness evaluation (task completeness, error patterns, engagement level)

Learners select 1 secondary school math curriculum area (functions, geometry, statistics) and develop an AR-based math activity design plan grounded in PBL (Problem-Based Learning) framework, obtaining ≥3.5/5.0 feedback from an expert evaluation panel
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
